com.swopteam07.tablr.view

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.swopteam07.tablr.view.View
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FormView, TableDesignView, TableRowView, TablesView

    public abstract class View
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that collects all the common attributes and methods for views such as TableId Design Mode and TableId Row Mode.

    • Field Detail

      • root

        protected final WindowPanel root
        The root component of this view. All other components are contained within.

      • controller

        protected final Controller controller
        A reference to the controller.

      • validState

        protected boolean validState
        Indicates whether or not the view is currently in a valid state, i.e. there are no illegal values entered.

      • lastSelectedComponent

        protected Component lastSelectedComponent
        The last component that was selected by a click in this view.

      • getRoot

        public final WindowPanel getRoot()
        Get the root component of this view.
        Returns:
        The root component of this view.

      • clickedBeneathView

        public abstract void clickedBeneathView(int y,
                                        int clickCount)
        Deal with a user clicking beneath the component.
        Parameters:
        y - The y coordinate of the point where the user clicked.
        clickCount - The number of times the user clicked beneath view.

      • escapePressed

        public void escapePressed()
        Deal with a user pressing escape.

      • ctrlDPressed

        public void ctrlDPressed()
        Reacts to the control + N key combination.

      • hasValidState

        public boolean hasValidState()
        Check if the view is in an illegal state, i.e. if any illegal values have been entered by the user.
        Returns:
        True if this view only contains valid literal, false otherwise.

      • updateCellWidths

        public abstract void updateCellWidths(int[] widths)
        Set new widths for the tables contained in this view.
        Parameters:
        widths - The new widths of the columns of this table.

      • blockUnblockInteraction

        public void blockUnblockInteraction(int rowId,
                                    int cellId,
                                    Table table)
        Blocks or unblock all interaction with anything but the cell given in the TableChangeEvent. Blocks when isInIllegalState() and unblocks when ! isInIllegalState().
        Parameters:
        rowId - The id of the row which contains the cell that can still be edited.
        cellId - The id of the cell that can still be edited.
        table - Reference to the table on which to block a single cell.

      • paint

        public final void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paint this component.
        Parameters:
        g - The graphics object on which to paint.

      • handleMouseEvent

        public void handleMouseEvent(int id,
                             int x,
                             int y,
                             int clickCount)
        React to user mouse input.
        Parameters:
        id - The type of mouse event.
        x - The x coordinate on which the mouse event occurred.
        y - The y coordinate on which the mouse event occurred.
        clickCount - The number of times the user clicked.

      • selectedDifferentComponent

        public abstract void selectedDifferentComponent()
        Action that should be taken when the user has selected a different part of the root view.

      • handleKeyEvent

        public void handleKeyEvent(int id,
                           int keyCode,
                           char keyChar)
        React to user pressing keys on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        id - The type of key event.
        keyCode - The code of the key that was pressed.
        keyChar - A character interpretation of the key that was pressed.

      • getTableId

        public abstract java.lang.Integer getTableId()
        Returns:
        The id of the table that this view allows the user to edit. Or null if the View doesn't allow a table to be editted.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int x,
                        int y)
        Check if the view contains the x and y coordinate.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate for which to check.
        y - The y coordinate for which to check.
        Returns:
        True if the view contains the coordinate, false otherwise.
